data.title: Dive into anything
data.text:
Obviously a lot about Alexander was romanticized, but one thing I've always heard, my entire life, is that Alexander inspired confidence by fighting alongside his men.

I don't find that itself hard to believe, but I often hear things like him "being the first one up the ladder or over the wall".

This is where I grow skeptical, because I know that antiquity-era battles had pretty high body counts, and I have doubts about Alexander running headlong into army after army and somehow surviving.

So I ask you, what do we know about Alexander's actual participation in the battles during his campaign?
